body:
We are using JFrog Artifactory with user:API-key for images. Docker CLI works without problems in our environment.

But when trying to pull an image from the same registry with `ctr` we observe that the code in `containerd/remotes/docker/resolver.go` does not use basic authentication which would work for Artifactory user:API-key. Instead, the code first calls the registry without authentication header, receives an UNAUTHORIZED (401), inspects the WWW-Authenticate header in the response, finds (in our case) the bearerAuth-scheme, and finally runs the retries with oauth but never uses basicAuth.

```
ctr --debug images pull -k --user <user>:<API-key> <imageref in artifactory>
DEBU[0000] fetching                   image="<imageref in artifactory>"
DEBU[0000] resolving
DEBU[0000] do request                 request.headers=map[Accept:[application/vnd.docker.distribution.manifest.v2+json, applicatst.v2+json, 
application/vnd.oci.image.manifest.v1+json, application/vnd.oci.image.index.v1+json, *]] request.method=HEAD url="....."
DEBU[0000] fetch response received    response.headers=map[Server:[Artifactory/5.8.4] X-Artifactory-Node-Id:[artifactory-dal10-0ion:
[registry/2.0] Date:[Thu, 15 Feb 2018 21:47:51 GMT] Content-Type:[application/json;charset=ISO-8859-1] Connection:[keep-alive] 
X-Artifactory-Idc9a] Www-Authenticate:[Bearer realm="....:443"]] status="401 Unauthorized" url=" ...
DEBU[0000] Unauthorized               header="Bearer realm="https://....:443/artifa/v2/token",service="....:443""
DEBU[0000] token request failed       body="{
  "errors" : [ {
    "status" : 401,
    "message" : "Authentication is required"
  } ]
}" status="401 Unauthorized"
ctr: failed to resolve reference "<imageref in artifactory>": failed to fetch oauth token: unexpected
```

An option would help to tell/force `ctr` which authentication mechanism (baerer vs. oauth) to use for the `--user` option. Maybe there is another solution available?
title: Failure pulling images from JFrog Artifactory with authentication
